0.Name: Castle
0.Description:
You are in the King's grand castle with lots of granite
stones, marble floors, and tapestries. So many tapestries!
There appears to be only one way out, it's to the East
outside where you see a path with a large statue.

1.Name: Statue
1.Description:
You are on a path in an open wooded area, next to the path
is a statue of the King. It's kind of creepy, where ever you
move the eyes seem to follow you... creepy! To the North
looks like the gates to a town, to the East the path
continues through the forest.

2.Name: Path
2.Description:
You are on a path in a darkly wooden area with the trees
closing in. You can see a path with a statue to the west
and perhaps a house beyond the trees to the East.

3.Name: Well
3.Description:
You are in an open field with on old water well. The well
has a rotted rope and a broken bucket to the side of it. The
well doesn't appear to have been used in ages. To the South
of the field is a large manor with many room, and to the
North the field ends at mountain face with what looks like
a forboding cave.

4.Name: Manor Promenade
4.Description:
You are standing on the lawn of a great manor. Down the
gravel promenade, the manor is quite grand with a formal
fountain court and garden leading to the main doors of the
manor. To the North you see a large open field, to the East
is the fountain court and garden of the house, to the West
 a path leads into a dark forest.

5.Name: Fountain
5.Description:
Before you is a long garden leading to the country manor
with impeccably maintained topiary bushes in many fanciful
shapes and gravel pathways. Your eyes are drawn to the
immense fountain with water spouting horses, and cherubs
pouring water from vases. Quite the bucolic scene. To the
East is the main entrance of the house, to the West is a
long promenade across the house property.

6.Name: Dining Room
6.Description:
You've entered into a formal dining room (you are really
underdressed!). The table is set with the finest china on
display. On a sideboard in the room you see bottles of
liquor and elixirs, I'm sure they are purely for medicinal
purposes. To the East and South are closed doors leading
to other rooms.

7.Name: Kitchen
7.Description:
Through the door and see you are in a dingy, dirty kitchen.
Everything seems to be in disarray with pots and pans
on the floor, garbage in the corners, plates of uneaten
food, and I mean come on, what is that smell?!? To the North,
East, and South are sets of closed doors.

8.Name: Library
8.Description:
You are standing in the Library of the manor, although
ornate and quite grand you feel a sense of dread and
discomfort. The house is quiet, too quiet. The hairs
standing on the back of your neck tells you that something
evil is lurking in the shadows of this house. To the North
and East are a sets of closed doors, to the West is the
main door outside to the fountain court.

9.Name: Bedroom
9.Description:
This room is a bedroom, but I don't think a nap is in order,
you hear ghastly wailing coming from somewhere, and wait...
is something rustling in the bed sheets? I sure hope not.
The only ways out of this bedroom are closed doors to the
West and South.

10.Name: Servants Room
10.Description: A table, two chairs, a few simple beds, this looks like the household staff's quarters. A little tight, but comfortable enough. There are doors to the North, South, and West. Take your pick!

11.Name: Great Hall
11.Description:
You have entered the Great Hall. Family crests, classic
weapons of yore, and a vast table down the center of this
impressive room. With so many dour portraits of old men on
the walls, whoever decorated this room wasn't shy about
bragging about the family history. The West is the doorway
to the Library, to the North is a closed door.
